etymology.description: C (outer curves) + 曲 (bent lines) = object depicted with a curve -> bent
etymology.interpretation: The character 曲(曲) (qū, "bent") visually represents the concept of bending or curving with its structure. The two curved lines symbolize bending, illustrating the fundamental meaning of the character.

examples.chinese: 山路曲折(山路曲折)，尽显雄伟(盡顯雄偉)。
examples.pinyin: Shān lù qūzhé, jǐn xiǎn xióngwěi.
examples.english: The mountain road is winding, fully showcasing its grandeur.

examples.chinese: 他的胡须微微曲(他的鬍鬚微微曲)，仿佛在诉说故事(彷彿在訴說故事)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de húxū wēi wēi qū, fǎngfú zài sùshuō gùshi.
examples.english: His whiskers are slightly bent, as if telling a story.
